text: Shadow treasurer Jim Chalmers has hit out at the idea of broadening the base of GST, telling Sky News “Australians are already doing it tough enough”. “We’ve got stagnant wages, declining living standards, record household debt,” Mr Chalmers said. “People feel no matter how hard they work they can’t keep up with the cost of childcare or electricity or their health bills. “This would just be an extra burden on people who are already doing it tough enough.” Mr Chalmers’ comments come after Liberal Senator Dean Smith broke ranks, calling on the government to expand GST in a proposal that could raise up to $18 billion for the government annually. The Prime Minister shot the proposal down on Monday and told Sky News: "at the end of the day the numbers just did not add up, and we said we are not contemplating that and so it's not on the agenda".
